venue.name: Lindsay Chapel, First Church of Cambridge

item.description:
Featuring Ernest Hilbert, Ben Mazer, Jill McDonough, and Afaa Michael Weaver, poets whose work may be found in past, current, or forthcoming issues of Poetry Northeast. Free and open to the public. This event is sponsored by our own Pen & Anvil Press and its non-profit parent, the Boston Poetry Union.

Please plan to join us for refreshments, book signing, and conversation following the reading.

Of Hilbert: “[T]he only other poet who plies risk against reward so deftly is Pound.” -- G.M. Palmer

Of Mazer: “To read him is to follow him along a dreamlike corridor where everything is beautiful & nothing is as it seems.”
-- John Ashbery

Of McDonough: “[A] daring poet, formally sophisticated yet pushing the boundaries of form at every turn.” -- Gail Mazur

Of Weaver: “[His poems] are imbued with a vivid sense of language, a vivid sense of the world . . . . This is a singular talent.” --
Henry Louis Gates Jr.

More information about Poetry Northeast can be found online at http://poetryne.org or at http://facebook.com/poetrynortheast.

Please help spread the word about this event.
